diagnosis.priorTreatmentSummary: Total Abdominal Hysterectomy, Bilateral Salpingo-oophorectomy (TAH-BSO), Lymph Node Dissection (02/10/2025)
pathologyFindings: Negative pelvic and para-aortic lymph nodes (0/25).

treatmentPlan.modality: External Beam Radiation Therapy (EBRT) to Pelvis
treatmentPlan.targetVolumeSummary: PTV encompassing upper vagina, paravaginal tissues, and pelvic lymph node regions (common/external/internal iliac, obturator).
medications: Vaginal Dilator use recommended post-RT to prevent stenosis

ctSimulation.setupInstructions: Supine in VacLok bag. Full bladder / empty rectum protocol followed. Vaginal marker placed for delineation of vaginal cuff. SAD setup.
ctSimulation.referenceMarks: 3-point tattoos at isocenter projections (AP and bilateral laterals).
ctSimulation.contrastUsed: IV and/or oral contrast may be used per institutional protocol but not specified here.
ctSimulation.ctNotes: CT acquired for adjuvant pelvic IMRT planning.

dosimetry.constraints: Rectum V40Gy < 35%; Bladder V40Gy < 50%; Fem Head Max < 45 Gy; Bowel Max < 50 Gy
dosimetry.planNotes: Adjuvant pelvic IMRT for high-risk endometrial cancer. Plan meets all OAR constraints.

fractions.setupNotes: Daily CBCT for IGRT. Bladder filling consistent. Setup good.
fractions.sideEffects: Mild fatigue. 2 loose stools/day, managed with diet.
fractions.notes: Tolerating well. Reinforced bowel management/hydration instructions.

fractions.setupNotes: Daily CBCT for IGRT. Setup consistent.
fractions.sideEffects: Increased frequency of loose stools (4-5/day). Mild urinary frequency.
fractions.notes: Started Loperamide PRN with good effect. Monitoring GI toxicity closely.

imagingAndReports.summary: No evidence of metastatic disease. Uterus appears enlarged.
Detailed findings consistent w/ FIGO Stage II Endometrioid AdenoCa.
CT acquired with full bladder/empty rectum protocol. Vaginal marker placed.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Nancy Allen (Gyn Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt w/ post-menopausal bleeding, biopsy confirms Gr 2 Endometrioid AdenoCa. Staging scans negative for mets. Plan for TAH-BSO + LND. Discussed potential need for post-op RT based on path findings.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Nancy Allen (Gyn Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Patient underwent TAH-BSO + LND. Final path FIGO Stage II (cervical stromal invasion) with LVSI, >50% MI. Recommend adjuvant pelvic EBRT.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Susan Clark (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt s/p TAH-BSO for Stage II Endometrioid AdenoCa. High risk features present. Recommend adjuvant pelvic EBRT 45Gy/25fx via IMRT/VMAT. Discussed procedure, bowel/bladder prep, side effects (diarrhea, fatigue, urinary frequency, vaginal dryness/stenosis). Pt agrees. CT sim scheduled. Vaginal dilator use discussed.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Susan Clark (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt completed 5/25 fx. Reports mild fatigue, 2 loose stools/day managed with diet. No urinary issues. Tolerating well. Continue RT. Reinforce bowel management/hydration.

progressNotes.author: Dr. Susan Clark (Rad Onc)
progressNotes.summary: Pt reports increased frequency of loose stools (4-5/day), started Loperamide PRN with good effect. Mild urinary frequency. Fatigue moderate. Skin unremarkable. Continue RT. Monitor GI toxicity closely.

patientEducation.goalsDiscussed: Adjuvant pelvic radiation to reduce the risk of cancer recurrence in the pelvis based on high-risk features found at surgery.
patientEducation.sideEffectsReviewed: Acute: Diarrhea, fatigue, bladder irritation (frequency/urgency), mild skin reaction in groin/gluteal fold. Late: Chronic changes to bowel/bladder habits, low risk of pelvic fracture, vaginal dryness/stenosis.
patientEducation.safetyConsiderations: Importance of daily bladder/rectum prep. Following a low-residue diet if diarrhea occurs. Reporting uncontrolled diarrhea, significant bladder pain, or fever.
patientEducation.patientResponsibilities: Attend daily RT. Follow bladder/rectum prep instructions. Use vaginal dilator as instructed post-treatment to prevent stenosis.
patientEducation.medicationCompliance: Use Loperamide or other anti-diarrheal medication as instructed.
